item.title: Litter up and down this road, especially outside the Children’s Centre, 15th October
item.description:
There is always been rubbish up and down this road this road, I especially noticed it outside of The Children’s Centre. People are shoving cans inside tree cages, and there is rubbish all over the pavements. Please install more rubbish bins up this street and collect the litter!! It’s such an eyesore and it’s really bad for the environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Brumwell Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Trailer, 15th October
item.description:
This Trailer has been reported several times since 15th September but still remains on the yellow line outside 71 and 69 Swallowfield road along with otherr items that have been dumped there. I understand that it has been refered to another department but no action has been taken to remove the hazard
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swallowfield Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass area by Wyatt road, 15th October
item.description:
The grass area is so over grown that I can’t even walk on the pavement with a pram, I have a 1 year old and I have to walk with the pram on the road which is obviously very dangerous. Because it is never cleaned there are people who also leave their rubbish in the overgrown grass/weeds. This has gone on too long, it’s for our safety and our children’s.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead Trees, 15th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Court Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Bins permanently stored on pavement outside no 14, 15th October
item.description:
The resident of number 14 leaves bins in street block access for neighbours wheel chair, prams and forcing children on bikes and scooters on to the road, its a tightly parked street and I witnessed a near accident a child dropped of the pavement to avoid the bins and a reversing car nearly ran over them. Also a neighbour with mobility issues cant pass the bins with wheel chair and or walking aid and has to go into the road to get past
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alfriston Close, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Oven grown tree blocking out light 113 lenham road, 15th October
item.description:
Top of the tree blocking out light into her kitchen window. this was reported last year. she is more than happy for you to view the light from her property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lenham Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet
